alert.note: Alert for Prowers (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued December 02 at 11:56AM MST until December 02 at 1:30PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Northeastern Prowers County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 130 PM MST. * At 1154 AM MST, a dust channel was over Holly, or near Coolidge, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * Satellite imagery shows increasing dust along Highways 50 and 385, including areas from Granada, Holly and Bristol. Visibility less than 1/4 mile is likely. Locations impacted include... Holly, Granada, Hartman and Bristol. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
